shared_text:
Mountain Education Charter High School
June 26 at 9:54 AM ·

Congratulations to Hope Cunningham from the Dawson Site! Hope plans to finish cosmetology school at Lanier Tech. Hope also received a scholarship for her academic success. She would like to thank MECHS and Mr. Sagona for telling her that her efforts weren’t going by unnoticed and rewarding her for every little step she completed. She would also like to recognize Mrs. Grigsby and Mrs. Hendon for helping her and believing in her. She says, "They’re a true inspiration to me and I wouldn’t have graduated without them."
#classof2020 #graduation2020 #senior2020 #seniorspotlight #highschoolgraduation #mechsgrad #mechsgrad2020 #mountaineducationcharter #1stchoicefor2ndchance

post_text: As we near the end of the 2019-2020 school year MECHS would like to celebrate our students with the Bragging Wagon! We will be providing a drive-thru meal at the site on Tuesday, June 9 at 6:00 pm. Students and families, please remain in your vehicle at all times as you drive by and pick up this celebratory meal. In your bag, you will receive a hotdog, little Debbie snack, condiments, and a water bottle.

shared_text:
Mountain Education Charter High School
June 1 at 9:51 AM ·

Congratulations to Robert Holcombe, a senior from the Dawson Site. Robert is currently advancing in his position with Toyota while furthering his education in diesel mechanics. Robert would like to give Ms. Chastain a shoutout for always having his back and teaching him to communicate in various ways such as thinking before he speaks. "She took the time to work with me and find things that fit my personality best. She is always willing to try new things and help you any way she can. Her bright personality always made the senior room an inviting environment and a place you would like to be. Ms. Chastain will forever be a mentor to me." - Robert Great job Robert! We are proud of your hard work and dedication. #classof2020 #senior2020 #graduation #graduation2020 #seniorspotlight #mechsgrad #mechsgrad2020 #mountaineducationcharter #1stchoicefor2ndchance #dawsoncounty

shared_text:
Mountain Education Charter High School
May 27 at 10:38 AM ·

Congratulations to Dawson Site senior Belle Burt. Belle just enrolled in the Lanier Tech associates of nursing program to reach her goals of becoming a labor and delivery or NICU nurse! Her favorite quote is, "It always seems impossible until it’s done." -Ghandi Belle would like to thank Mr. Pete Sagona who had her back since she began at MECHS. "Every day he greats you with a smile and a fist bump. Always followed by words of encouragement and optimism. Pete goes above and beyond for his students and proves to them there is always a way even at the most uncertain moments. Mr. Sagona is an inspiration and will always have a place in my heart." - Belle Awesome job Belle, we are so proud of you! #classof2020 #mechsgrad #mechsgrad #graduation #graduation2020 #senior2020 #seniorspotlight #mountaineducationcharter #dawsoncounty #1stchoicefor2ndchance

shared_text:
Mountain Education Charter High School
April 17 at 1:38 PM ·

MECHS is working diligently to provide the safest option for a commencement ceremony for the spring of 2020. Graduation was originally scheduled for May 30th; however, due to the current situation with COVID-19 graduation will either be postponed until later this summer or we will host a virtual ceremony. With that being said, Dr. Lovell and everyone at MECHS would prefer to host traditional graduation with virtual being the absolute last resort. We are working with the University of North Georgia for potential new dates and times. Once we have more guidance from Governor Kemp and the Department of Education, we will communicate that to all of you. Please be assured that graduation will be happening whether at a later date or virtually.

shared_text:
Mountain Education Charter High School
March 30 at 5:17 PM ·

If you find yourself feeling isolated, worried about your family, concerned about being alone at home with children for days or weeks, or in need of essential resources like food or funds for utilities and rent, please call 1-800-CHILDREN (244-5373). MECHS counselors are also available to families and students during this time. Let’s navigate this new normal together.

post_text: All Mountain Education Charter High School locations will remain closed until further notice due to the impact of COVID-19 in our communities. Because national and state information about the coronavirus changes daily, we are unable to make decisions about when school will resume. Online learning will continue Monday through Thursday from 4-9 pm.

Online learning will continue Monday through Thursday from 4-9 pm.

post_text:
EOCs - Important Information - Dates changed
With all sites closed next week, students cannot test at any site. That means all students must wait until the spring schedule to take their EOCs.

Monday, April 27 - ELA Section 1

Tuesday, April 28 - ELA Sections 2 & 3

Wednesday, April 29 - All math

Thursday, April 30 - makeup day for ELA and math

Monday, May 4 - All science

Tuesday, May 5 - All social studies

Wednesday, May 6 - makeup day for science and social studies

PLEASE NOTE THAT TESTS CANNOT BE GIVEN EXCEPT DURING THE WEEK IN WHICH THEY ARE SCHEDULED.

post_text: The semester college field trip to Lanier Technical College Dawson Campus, was a huge success today! MECHS students visited the Certified Nursing Assistant Classroom, Cosmetology Classroom, Electrical Classroom and Automotive Classrooms as well many others. A huge thanks to Troy Lindsey, Dean of the Dawson Campus, for hosting our students!

A huge thanks to Troy Lindsey, Dean of the Dawson Campus, for hosting our students!

post_text: Suicide prevention speaker, Kevin Hines, will be at Dawson County High School Performing Arts Center tonight (8/29) at 6:30. He has a powerful message regarding suicide.
shared_text:
Dawson County School System Board of Education
August 29, 2019 at 10:48 AM ·

This morning, Kevin Hines delivered his message on suicide prevention, hope and healing to our high and junior high students.

TONIGHT (8/29) at 6:30PM, he will speak to our parents and community at the Performing Arts Center. We hope you will join us for this very valuable message! #beheretomorrow

A special thanks to AC Harwell for sponsoring the tournament.
